com.github.liblevenshtein.transducer

Class StateTransitionFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.liblevenshtein.transducer.StateTransitionFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class StateTransitionFunction
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Transitions one state to another, given a set of inputs. This function doesn't need to know about the Levenshtein algorithm, as the algorithm-specific components are injected via setters.
    Since:
    2.1.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Comparator<Position> comparator
      Sorts State elements in an unsubsumption-friendly fashion.
      private int maxDistance
      Max number of errors tolerated in spelling candidates, from the query term.
      private MergeFunction merge
      Merges states together according to the Levenshtein algorithm.
      private int queryLength
      Length of the query term.
      private static long serialVersionUID 
      private StateFactory stateFactory
      Builds and recycles State instances.
      private PositionTransitionFactory transitionFactory
      Builds position vector, transition functions according to the Levenshtein algorithm.
      private UnsubsumeFunction unsubsume
      Removes positions from a state that are subsumed by other positions in that state.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public State of(State currState,
                boolean[] characteristicVector)
        Returns the state consisting of all the possible position-transitions from the current state, given the characteristic vector.
        Parameters:
        currState - Source state to transition from.
        characteristicVector - Relevant subwords denoting whether the indices of the current, spelling candidate from the dictionary has characters matching the one being sought from the query term.
        Returns:
        Next state, consisting of all possible position-transitions from the source currState, conditioned on characteristicVector.
